info.title: NOMIS Synchronisation API
info.description: Controls writing Prisoner information back to NOMIS for data synchronisation (not intended for general usage)

get.summary: Returns if the service is switched on for the specified service code / agency id.
get.description:
Returns 204 if the service is switched on for the service code / agency id combination.
    If the service is not switched on then 404 is returned.
    This endpoint also takes into account the special `*ALL*` agency id - if the service code has a agency entry of
    `*ALL*` then the service is deemed to be switched on for all agencies and will therefore return 204 irrespective of the
    agency id that is passed in.
    Requires role NOMIS_PRISONER_API__SYNCHRONISATION__RW

parameters.name: serviceCode
parameters.description: The code of the service from the EXTERNAL_SERVICES table

schema.description: The code of the service from the EXTERNAL_SERVICES table

204.description: Service is switched on for the service code and agency id.

400.description: Bad request

403.description: Forbidden, requires role NOMIS_PRISONER_API__SYNCHRONISATION__RW

404.description: The service code does not exist or the service is not switched on for the agency.

post.summary: Turn on a service for a agency
post.description: Turn on a service for a agency. Requires role NOMIS_PRISONER_API__SYNCHRONISATION__RW

get.summary: Gets all case notes for a prisoner for reconciliation.
get.description:
Retrieves all case notes for a specific prisoner, for reconciliation. 
    This endpoint doesn't try to split out a case note into the amendments, simply just returns the text as stored in
    NOMIS. This is because the notes are truncated at 4,000 characters so we can end up with more amendments in DPS
    than there are in NOMIS. We therefore just return the text as stored in NOMIS and then transform the DPS text to
    match.
